Submodules¶

m4i_analytics.m4i.ApiUtils module¶

class m4i_analytics.m4i.ApiUtils.ApiUtils[source]¶

This class provides various utility functions for API classes that connect with Models4Insight.

static get(params={}, contentType=<ContentType.TEXT: 'text'>)[source]¶

Make a HTTP GET request with the given parameters to the given url. Specify what kind of result you expect by providing the content type.

Returns:

The response of the server, parsed to the specified content type (TEXT by default).
Parameters:
  • url (str) – The url to which the request will be made.
  • params (dict) – Optional. The parameters to provide with the request. By default, no parameters will be provided.
  • contentType (ContentType) – Optional. The type of result you are expecting. By default, the content type is set to TEXT.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when the url, params and/or contentType are not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when the url, params and/or contentType are not valid.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static post(data={}, contentType=<ContentType.TEXT: 'text'>)[source]¶

Make a HTTP POST request with the given data to the given url. Specify what kind of result you expect by providing the content type.

Returns:

The response of the server, parsed to the specified content type (TEXT by default).
Parameters:
  • url (str) – The url to which the request will be made
  • data (dict) – Optional. The data to provide with the request. By default, no data will be provided.
  • contentType (ContentType) – Optional. The type of result you are expecting. By default, the content type is set to TEXT.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when the url, data and/or contentType are not defined
  • ValueError – Thrown when the url, data and/or contentType are not valid
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant
class m4i_analytics.m4i.ApiUtils.ContentType[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

This class enumerates various content types. Use these values to specify what kind of result you expect from your request.

BINARY = 'binary'¶
JSON = 'json'¶
RAW = 'raw'¶
TEXT = 'text'¶
